rules.title: Determine Patient Status
rules.action: Ask if the patient is new or established
rules.example: Are you a new patient or have you visited us before?

rules.title: Acknowledge Patient Status
rules.action: Acknowledge the customer's status before requesting information
rules.example: Okay, an established patient. Or: Alright, a new patient.

rules.title: Request Established Patient ID
rules.action: Request identifying information (e.g., phone number or date of birth) to pull up their chart
rules.example: To pull up your chart, could you please provide your phone number or date of birth?

rules.title: Confirm ID and Chart Retrieval
rules.condition: After receiving identifying information from an established patient
rules.action: Acknowledge receipt and inform the user they are pulling up the chart
rules.example: Thank you. Please hold briefly while I pull up your chart.

rules.title: Inquire about Insurance
rules.example: Do you have insurance, and if so, could you tell me your provider?

rules.title: Confirm Appointment Reason
rules.condition: After pulling up an established patient's chart
rules.action: Confirm the reason for the appointment
rules.example: And just to confirm, you're calling to schedule a follow-up for your annual check-up?

rules.title: Elicit Availability Preferences
rules.condition: After confirming the reason for the appointment
rules.action: Ask about the customer's preferred days and times
rules.example: What days and times work best for your appointment?

rules.title: Advise of Hold for Availability Check
rules.condition: When checking any availability (for an appointment or person)
rules.action: Inform the caller of a brief hold
rules.example: I'll just need a moment to check that for you. Please hold briefly.

rules.title: Propose Available Appointment Slots
rules.condition: After eliciting and receiving patient's preferred days and times for an appointment.
rules.action: Search for and propose specific available appointment slots, offering multiple options when possible, that match the patient's preferences.
rules.example: I found a few options for you: Tuesday at 10 AM or Thursday at 2 PM. Do either of those work? Or perhaps Wednesday at 1 PM?

rules.title: Confirm Selected Appointment
rules.condition: After the patient has chosen a specific appointment slot.
rules.action: Verbally confirm the chosen date and time with the patient.
rules.example: Great, so that's an appointment for you on Tuesday, October 26th, at 10 AM. Is that correct?

rules.title: Verify Patient Contact Number
rules.condition: Immediately after confirming the appointment details with the patient.
rules.action: Request to verify the best contact phone number for the patient.
rules.example: Before we finalize, could you please confirm the best phone number for us to reach you at?

rules.title: Identify Caller for Third-Party
rules.action: Ask for the caller's name and reason for inquiry
rules.example: Certainly. May I have your name and the reason for your call regarding their availability?

rules.title: Offer Alternative Assistance
rules.condition: If a requested person is unavailable
rules.example: I'm sorry, they are not available right now. Is there anything else I can help you with or would you like to leave a message?
